reviews.sentence: Good hotel but expensive. Very good location right on the beach with plenty of sunbeds. Very nice staff and excellent restaurant and bar. Also very good pool and spa facilities. The rooms are old and the air conditioning was defect so room got terribly warm. Also carpet floors sandy feet bad combination. Never got the room quite clean. But overall a very good hotel experience.

There was no air conditioning in the room so it was very hot and it forced us to open the windows. Opening the windows was very noisy as our room faced a car park and at night we could hear car doors and lorries. The room was clean enough but could have been better. The reception staff were helpful and nice. Overall it was an okay experience.

Location and staff 55. Hotel design a different decor 25. Location of hotel is superb. Actually built into the beach. And the beach is HUGE. Staff were excellent and as it was a quiet November they upgraded us to a sea view for free. Very polite and efficient. BUT and it is an important but. unles you have a sea view then the rooms are like prison cells. We originally had a dune view which sounded OK. But actually means a very small single window which overlooks the car park a day let us in next to zero light. The dune view room was very small and incredibly dark. Actually quite depressing. The overall decor and design of the hotel is tired dirty room vents damaged ikea furniture from the 70s peeling paint even the restaurant had an odour of cigarettes and old food. However if you get a sea view then it makes up for any failings. We did not try the spa but it looked clean and fairly new. Summary get a Seaview or go elsewhere. Unles the dune view is under € 50Advice to owners manager your desk staff Adeline are very professional. Your location is incredible. Lower the cost of the dune view rooms. Give the hotel a good lick of paint. Renovate.

Compared to other Novotel Thalaso hotels we found Le Touquet below our expectations. Excellent view to the sea. Room too small and uncomfortable. Long crowded and dirty corridors. Breakfast minimalist eg only two sorts of cheese on offer and lacked the healthy corner. The restaurant was nothing special staff was overworked the dinning room was noisy eg children using the piano to play and nobody did anything about it and the tables were too close to each other and often in an odd layout.

Fantastic beach and sea views worth paying more for. Great room breakfast and pool. Shame it is shut at lunch. but in France that is what they doPs the settee sofa bed in the room was so old and tatty let down the rest of the rooms ambience.

First visit nice location by sea very dated. Nice location on the beach. A winter break so ideal for walks on beach. But cold. Our room was very dated. They left us 1 English tea bag for 2 people 2 milk cartons how stingy. Only 1 shampoo shower gel. Very poor. The pool was ok very busy. We arrived late to use sauna spa facilities plus they charged € 20 each. We dined out but came back to hotel for a drink they were closing did not even bother to let us have 1 drink. there is no where to sit like a cosy lounge area to watch tv or read or just relax. We were forced to go back to bedroom at 11 pm as no where else to go in hotel. We did not have breakfast although € 1850 euros each. Far buy our worst stay. Pricey in my opinion for what you get.

Most appalling weather and the bathroom was not much better. An over bath shower was not what I would expect at the prices charged and this over bath shower was worse than most. The bottom of the bath was slippery and had a hump in the middle. The back of the bath had an exaggerated slope which meant that even when standing as close as possible to the shower head you could not get your head directly below the shower.

Our stay was satisfactory. However the check in was NOT. We arrived early so I did the check in and was told I would be given a call when room was ready. I had requested rooms either 240 or 24 as they have a bath tub and are close to the main door we travel with our dog. I was told room No could not be confirmed. Came back at 1610 hs and was told they had a late check out so room was still not ready it would take 20 minutes. Got vouchers for the bar. The luggage was left at the front and would be taken to the room. Went back to reception at 1710 luggage was still there and they had to check if room was finally ready. Then and only then did they help us with the luggage and we got access to the room. We had booked weeks ago.
Great location great hotel good staff but rooms a little tired. Great break used this hotel a few times now great for the children right on the beach. Rooms need decorating that all.
Good. The location and views from restaurant and bar. The room was a little outdated although clean mattress was n’t the best.

Our stay at the newly refurbished Novotel. After a long wait we were very much looking forward to returning to one of our favourite Novotel Hotel. We were however disappointed. Stylish design but very poor finishes. Main restaurant new diner carte very scarce if you want mussels caesar salad and stylish diverse desserts then you have to go to the Bar area downstairs serving as The Brasserie not well advertised. The bunk beds room in what is called a Junior Suite was not even fitted with lights although you had switches on the walls. The large Suites large veranda style windows overlooking the sea. once one of our favourites are now only for up to 3 people max reason being the Direction decided to fit the living room area with a single sofa bed and not double. A clever way of selling more rooms instead. The staff uniform looking cheap and a bit ridicule. Staff however remain as welcoming and helpful as ever an asset to this hotel.

A good hotel but not a value for the price. The property has a good ambiance and a heated indoor pol The bar and restaurant is decent if you do not want to go out The rooms are generally clean The bathroom is well equipped with all of the toiletries we ned The parking was all consumed by non hotel staying people and hence even with parking for hotel patrons we could not park in the hotel premises The WC was very small and had no working exhaust The location is further away from the main area but not a big problem The staff at the reception are not smiling or talking and working like robots.

I booked the hotel due to spa and room sizes. On arrival we were told the spa was closed till June. this was n’t stated anywhere. This was a huge disappointment. We booked superior sea view room this room was smaller than on the pictures. They were clean but minimal.

Would not stay anywhere else. WOW. Its the best. Newly renovated had proper coffee maker in room as well as fridge for beer. The breakfast was worth the money great quality ingredience great view of beach all in all Great package. Nothing.

Relaxing beach front hotel. Very relaxing and nicely refurbished rooms helpful staff. Room service of high standard. Love the access to beach from the downstairs bar. Will be nicer when work on the Ibis next door is finished as our room looked at porter cabins and parking will be easier too.

Poor customer service. We booked a room with a free bar included in the price. What this consists of is a fridge containing two small bottles of water. I raised this with reception staff and they stated that this was correct. I found the staff to be unwlecoming surly and not in the least bit acomodating. I would not recommend this hotel. Aditionaly it is currently next to a large building site.

Mrs Sharon M. We are very glad that we booked and paid for a sea view room as the rooms looking over to the dunes parking which we almost booked ad appalling views. Looking over workmens porta cabins and work taking place it really is a horrific building site all around this hotel at the moment. I have many photos and video to show you. The parking area was terrible for a 4 star hotel and cars were parked everywhere. The Novotel itself was OK but not worth the money at all and we have stayed in many Novotel hotels and I have worked in travel for 25 years.

White sands private beach gorgeous sunset view. It ’s a nice hotel indeed specially the swimming pool area. The room was standard cleaned with 2 separate single beds for my 2 big kids. A free parking spot not far away from city centre shopping area or aqualud. Lovely white sands beach and beautiful sunset. July 1st.

Our visit to le Touquet. Great hotel great views over the sea and beach easy parking great amenities saltwater pool was great there was a bit of building work going on did not worry use looks like the were improving the hotel with a gym. Restaurant and bar were lovely with a great view not cheap 8 Euro a pintThe town itself is great. There is NO information in the room what there is to do in the area which was not very good. Also you can not change English pounds into Euro anywhere in the town no bureau de change anywhere to make sure you have cards or cash euros on youAdrian Anabele Stratman The Hurst Arms Pub in Eastbourne.

Ideal for beach and a reasonable walk into town. Very nice room. completely refitted and redecorated since we last stayed at this hotel. Comfy bed and pillows tea coffee facilities safe minibar excellent shower and very good water pressure even on top floor two USB charging points and a few mains sockets too. Fabulous view from sea facing room decent balcony with chairs and a table. can not fault any of this it was all great.

Great sea views. We stayed here for a night en route to further south in France. Parking spaces were at ba premium as the hotel was full and initially we were parked in a very windy spot with the car being blasted with sand from the nearby dunes. Fortunately we were able to move it soon afterwards. Lovely views from hotel and pool spectacular. We did not eat in restaurant as it was fully booked so went into town. Bed not very comfortable. Other than that a good stay.

Lovely location avoid dune view. Booked a dune view and ended up with a view of a load of containers payed a lot of money to stay here so very disappointing. Room condition was average so again not good for the money. Position of the hotel directly on the beach was only real positive.

This hotel was ideally placed for the beach with direct access to sun beds and chairs. The beach is literally 20 m from the hotel entrance. Parking was fine though very busy at times. The hotel was clean and tidy at all times and the staff were excellent. The pool was large though it was warm it was salt water. Towels were provided at the pool and there were lockers showers and changing rooms. The restaurant was beautiful with stunning views. The breakfast buffet had plenty of choice and was always well stocked. The room was lovely and the balcony a good size.

Enjoyed stay but accessible room compromised following refurbishment. Efficient friendly and helpful service throughout the hotel. We have used this hotel many times over the past 20 years. It badly needed refurbishment so it was nice to see this is happening although some of the fit and finish is not up to 4 standards. We booked a wheelchair accessible room. It has always been small but now is very small. My hoist would not fit under the bed due to the bed lifting mechanism which led to difficulties on our first night. Housekeeping changed the bed the next day which helped greatly. The quality of the breakfast is now much better and while the restaurant food was nice choice is very limited. We do though love the position of the hotel.

magnificent. I have been a customer of yours for over 20 years and I cam to celebrate to 50th Birthday with my son. Isabel is still there and always amazing such a great lady and always so hospitible. It was a mini break of dreams and I can not thank you enough for the amazing time we experienced.

A very surprising find. As I was n’t expecting very much after all it is a Novotel I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. We received a warm welcome on arrival and the hotel has a open feel with a wall of windows with magnificent views to the open sea. The deck bar makes you want to just sit and let the strain of a long trip just wash away. The Bed room was clean if a little basic but the bed was so comfortable it was like a warm hug. We stayed in the hotel for dinner and OMG the sea food buffet was magnificent and I wish I had taken a photo to show you. It would n’t have been out of place in a 5star hotel I wish I had booked the hotel for a extra night. The downside on the day we stayed the hotel had no water for about 8hrs but this did n’t impact on our stay as the staff seemed to cope with very little impact on guests.

Very Good. Room was more spacious than anticipated bed was really comfortable. Our room door had a paint job that was flaking off and was leaving pieces in room hallway so that should ’ve been taken care of.
